word.entryDescription: a young dog
word.entryExample: I got my dog when he was a puppy.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something that is purple is the colour between red and blue
word.entryExample: My mum is wearing a purple hat.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a small bag most often used by a woman to keep her money
word.entryExample: I keep my money in a purse.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to move something away from you or to another position usually with your hands
word.entryExample: Push the bike up the hill.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to move something into a particular position
word.entryExample: Can you put the flowers into water, please?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to cover a part of your body with a piece of clothing
word.entryExample: It's very windy, so put on your coat.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to raise something to a higher position
word.entryExample: Put your hand up if you want to ask a question.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: small pieces of wood in different shapes that you join together to make a picture
word.entryExample: Can you help me with this puzzle?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: clothes you wear in bed when you sleep
word.entryExample: I put on my pyjamas before I go to bed.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a woman who rules a country or a king's wife
word.entryExample: Can we meet the queen in London?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something that someone asks you when they want information
word.entryExample: Are you ready to answer the next question?
word.label: ydp

word.entryExample: Sam is a quick runner.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: in a fast way
word.entryExample: Come here quickly and look at this.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: making little or no sound
word.entryExample: I live in a quiet street.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: in a way which does not make a lot of sound
word.entryExample: She speaks very quietly.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a small furry animal with long ears and a short bushy tail, often kept for food or as a pet
word.entryExample: Rabbits like to jump
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a competition in which you try to finish faster than the others
word.entryExample: Let's watch the race on TV.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: drops of water that fall from clouds
word.entryExample: Is there a lot of rain in your country?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: boots you wear to protect you from the rain
word.entryExample: You need rain boots today. It's wet outside.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a curve of several colours that can be seen in the sky when there is both sun and rain at the same time
word.entryExample: Look! There's a rainbow in the sky.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a coat you wear to protect you from the rain
word.entryExample: Take your raincoat with you – it's raining!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a thick forest in a tropical area where it rains a lot
word.entryExample: The rainforest is home to some amazing animals.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: when it is rainy there is rain falling from the sky
word.entryExample: On rainy days we stay indoors.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to look at words or symbols in a book and understand what they mean
word.entryExample: The teacher asked the students to read the book for homework.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an activity in which you read a book, magazine, newspaper, etc
word.entryExample: I go to the library often because I love reading,
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: prepared for what is going to happen
word.entryExample: When your pens are ready, you can start the test.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: true in your mind or in the world and not false
word.entryExample: Is that real fur?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to use metal, paper, plastic and glass again
word.entryExample: We must recycle rubbish because it's good for the planet.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something that is red is the colour of blood (=the liquid inside your body)
word.entryExample: She's wearing a red T-shirt.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a place where you can go to have a meal
word.entryExample: Did you like the new restaurant?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a very large heavy animal with thick grey skin and a horn on its head
word.entryExample: Can you see the rhino in the river under the tree?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: (for words, lines of poetry, etc) to end with similar sounds
word.entryExample: Not all poems have to rhyme!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: very small white grains which are boiled to make them soft enough to eat
word.entryExample: Rice is a popular food in Asia.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to travel on a bicycle
word.entryExample: Can you ride a bike?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the sport or activity of riding a horse or a bike
word.entryExample: This story is about riding a horse.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a long area on which vehicles drive
word.entryExample: Walk quickly across the road.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a machine that can do work by itself, often work that people do
word.entryExample: My parents gave me a toy robot for birthday yesterday.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an inside part of a building that has its own walls
word.entryExample: Is this the picture of your new room?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: things you do not want and throw away
word.entryExample: Look at all this rubbish in the kitchen!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a thing you use to draw straight lines and measure things
word.entryExample: I carry my ruler in a pencil case.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to move more quickly than walking using your legs
word.entryExample: I like to run in the park.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to escape
word.entryExample: Run away from the cat, little mouse!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: somebody who runs, especially in races
word.entryExample: Who's your favourite runner?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an activity in which you run
word.entryExample: He likes running.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: not happy
word.entryExample: Don't be sad, I'll tell you a funny story.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to control a boat which has a large cloth attached to a tall pole, and is pushed by the wind
word.entryExample: Would you like to sail around the world?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a sport or activity in which people sail boats
word.entryExample: The weather is great so let's go sailing on the lake.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a dish of mixed vegetables which you eat raw
word.entryExample: I'd like tomato and cucumber salad, please.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the very small fine pieces of rock that you find on beaches and in deserts
word.entryExample: They are playing with the sand.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: two pieces of bread with other food between them
word.entryExample: I take sandwiches to work every day.
word.label: ydp
